revised_title: Experimental Researches on the Mode of Operation of Poisons
tldr: The author examines the effects of poisons on the nervous system and their circulation in the body. He concludes that the time required for a substance to penetrate capillary vessels is negligible, and the interval between absorption and general diffusion through the body may not exceed nine seconds. The contact of a poison with a large surface of the body is not sufficient to cause general symptoms if its diffusion is prevented.
